publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1997# Dr Elaine Murray: Recognition of the Achievements of James Clerk Maxwell—That the Parliament notes the 125th anniversary of the death of James Clerk Maxwell, one of Scotland’s greatest scientists, whose work paved the way for television and radio; considers that the Scottish Executive should give consideration to commemorating the work of this outstanding physicist, and believes that Maxwell’s achievements should be promoted in Scotland’s schools to encourage more pupils to study science at school and in further and higher education.

S2M-1997# Recognition of the Achievements of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 12 November 2004) Maureen Macmillan*, Alex Neil*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Richard Baker*, Mr David Davidson*, Alex Fergusson*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-1997# Recognition of the Achievements of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 12 November 2004) Phil Gallie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Nora Radcliffe*, David Mundell*, Christine May*, Richard Lochhead*, Chris Ballance*, Des McNulty*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Murray Tosh*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Sarah Boyack*, Trish Godman*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Brian Adam*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Jackie Baillie*, Ms Sandra White*, Helen Eadie*, Alasdair Morgan*, Mike Pringle*, Tricia Marwick*, Shiona Baird*, Rob Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Patrick Harvie*, John Scott*, Robert Brown*
S2M-1997# Recognition of the Achievements of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 12 November 2004) Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Frank McAveety*
S2M-1997# Recognition of the Achievements of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 12 November 2004) Cathie Craigie*, Pauline McNeill*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Scott Barrie*
S2M-1997# Recognition of the Achievements of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 12 November 2004) Susan Deacon*
